snippet: A turn from the microblogging service Sina Weibo to the Facebook-like WeChat has reoriented the nation’s social media landscape from public to semiprivate communication.
abstract: Sina Weibo, Chinese microblogging site that created open public forum and served as incubator of social change, has been eclipsed by social networking site WeChat following government crackdown on Weibo; WeChat fosters communication between self-selected groups of followers, signaling shift from public to semi-private communication and decline of large-scale information sharing.
lead_paragraph: A turn from the microblogging service Sina Weibo to the Facebook-like WeChat has reoriented the nation’s social media landscape from public to semiprivate communication.

headline.main: An Online Shift in China Muffles an Open Forum
headline.print_headline: An Online Shift in China Muffles an Open Forum
